description_txt: stated on January 14, 2009 in statement to reporters:
quote_txt: Geithner's failure to pay self-employment taxes while working for the IMF "is a mistake that is commonly made for people who are working internationally or for international institutions."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2009 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Geithner still didn't correct the same type of error for some years, even after the Internal Revenue Service flagged him for the failure to pay the taxes in other years."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2009 in during a news conference:
quote_txt: Bush's tax cuts for high earners "have been the biggest contributor to the budget deficit."

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2009 in an interview on MSNBC's Hardball.:
quote_txt: "The biggest job of the surgeon general is to translate health care and health care needs into plain English."

description_txt: stated on December 21, 2008 in TV interview:
quote_txt: "Mr. Warren compared same-sex couples to incest."

description_txt: stated on December 17, 2008 in Press release:
quote_txt: The Rev. Rick Warren "has called Christians who advance a social gospel Marxists."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2008:
quote_txt: "Even with recent changes, the average hourly wage at General Motors is still $75 an hour."

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2009 in in a news interview:
quote_txt: If Obama's economic plan creates 600,000 new government jobs, "that's about the size of the post office work force."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2008 in a speech in Springfield, Mo.:
quote_txt: Obama would "experiment with socialism."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2008 in a debate in Hempstead, N.Y.:
quote_txt: "And 100 percent, John, of your ads . . . 100 percent of them have been negative."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2008 in a statement by Sen. Claire McCaskill in a TV ad. :
quote_txt: Obama "changed the rules in Washington. Gone are the free gifts from lobbyists. Gone are the fancy airplane rides for nothing."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2008 in a speech in Roanoke, Va.:
quote_txt: "Senator McCain would pay for part of his (health care) plan by making drastic cuts in Medicare — $882-billion worth."

description_txt: stated on October 23, 2008 in remarks by chief strategist Steve Schmidt:
quote_txt: "The McCain campaign is roughly in the position where Vice President Gore was running against President Bush one week before the election of 2000."

description_txt: stated on October 7, 2008 in Nashville, Tenn.:
quote_txt: "Sen. Obama has never taken on his party leaders on a single major issue."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2008 in campaign Web site:
quote_txt: The accuracy of the Obama tax calculator

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2008 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: Michelle Obama ordered $400 worth of lobster and caviar at a New York hotel.

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2008 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "The race will tighten, just because that's what happens at the end of campaigns. They always have."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2008 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: "Obama raises taxes on seniors (and) hard-working families to give welfare to those who pay none."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2008:
quote_txt: "For my energy plan, my economic plan, and the other proposals you'll hear tonight, I've offered spending cuts above and beyond their cost."

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2008 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "We are within the margin of error."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2008 in in a television ad:
quote_txt: Measures in Barack Obama's health plan could "lower health care costs for the typical family by $2,500 a year."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2008 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "Fidel (Castro) has made his preferences known in the campaign and had some very unkind things to say about me."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2008 in Hershey, Pa. :
quote_txt: Barack Obama said "people making less than $250,000 would benefit from his plan" then said "if you're a family making less than $200,000, you'll benefit."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2008 in North Carolina:
quote_txt: McCain called for less regulation 21 times just this year.

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2008 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "In April, Sen. McCain came out against helping women earn equal pay for equal work."

description_txt: stated on October 27, 2008 in a television advertisement:
quote_txt: McCain is "selectively editing Joe Biden's words...Biden actually said about Barack Obama: 'They're gonna find out this guy's got steel in his spine.'"

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2008 in a TV ad airing in Florida:
quote_txt: "Obama says Iran is a 'tiny' country, 'doesn't pose a serious threat.'"

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2008 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: "Barack Obama has consistently voted against tougher penalties for criminals."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2008 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: John McCain's health care plan "won't guarantee coverage of cancer screenings or maternity care."

description_txt: stated on October 23, 2008 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "One percent of the American people make over 21 percent of all the income in America. That wasn’t the way before George Bush became president."
